intro: Perymenium album, commonly known as the white perymenium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant is native to certain regions of southern Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland and grassland habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and recognizable species within its native environment.
